trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> enables you to perform functions such as hit testing, clipping, and erasing strokes.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> control performs many of these functions, but if you need more control than the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> provides, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> offers more options.
The following table lists where to learn about managing digital ink on a custom control.
To do thisâ€¦
See this article
Create a control that collects digital ink
[Creating an Ink Input Control](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/creating-an-ink-input-control.md)
Create a control that enables the user to select ink
[How to: Select Ink from a Custom Control](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/how-to-select-ink-from-a-custom-control.md)
Create a control that enables the user to point-erase ink
[How to: Erase Ink on a Custom Control](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/how-to-erase-ink-on-a-custom-control.md)
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Object Element Usage
XAML Values
Term
Definition
A string that represents the stroke in base-64, encoded Ink Serialized Format (ISF).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> class that contains the specified strokes.
The strokes to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Initializes a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> of Ink Serialized Format (ISF).
A stream that contains ink data.
Adds the specified strokes to the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Add%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> to add to the collection.
A in strokes is already a member of the .
strokes is `null`.
Adds a custom property to the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.AddPropertyData%2A> method enables you to add custom properties to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
You can then include extra information with a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> to associate with the custom property.
The value of the custom property.
propertyData must be of type , , , , , , , , , , , , , or an array of these data types, except , which is not allowed.
propertyDataId is an empty .
-or-
propertyData is not one of the allowed data types listed in the `Parameters` section.
Clears all strokes from the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Removes all strokes in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that are outside the bounds of the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> array.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Clip%2A> method connects the first and last points in `lassoPoints` to create the lasso.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Clip%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it clips.
An array of type <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that specifies the area to be clipped.
Replaces all strokes that are clipped by the specified rectangle with new strokes that do not extend beyond the specified rectangle.
All strokes that are entirely outside the specified rectangle are removed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the area to be clipped.
Copies the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Clone%2A> method copies each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> in the collection and the new <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> references the new strokes.
A copy of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Returns whether the specified custom property identifier is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the specified custom property identifier is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Draws the strokes in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> on which to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Removes the ink that is within the bounds of the specified area.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method connects the first and last points in `lassoPoints` to create the lasso.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> might contain new strokes after the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method is called.
For example, if the specified area is through the middle of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the erase method removes that <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> and creates two new strokes.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it erases.
An array of type <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that specifies the area to be erased.
Replaces all strokes that are clipped by the specified rectangle with new strokes that do not enter the bounds of the specified rectangle.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> might contain new strokes after the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method is called.
For example, if the specified area is through the middle of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the erase method removes that <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> and creates two new strokes.
All strokes that are entirely inside the specified rectangle are removed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it erases.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the area to be erased.

Replaces all strokes that are clipped by the region created by the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref> along the specified path with new Strokes that are not clipped by the region.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> might contain new strokes after the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method is called.
For example, if `path` intersects the middle of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the erase method removes that <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> and creates two new strokes.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Erase%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it erases.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that specifies the path to be erased.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref> that specifies the shape of the eraser.
Returns the bounds of the strokes in the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.GetBounds%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Rect> that takes the appearance of the rendered <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
For example, if <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is 10 display independent pixels (DIP) wide, the <xref:System.Windows.Rect> includes the entire width of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that contains the bounds of the strokes in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Creates an <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester"></xref> that hit tests the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> with a lasso (freehand) path.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.GetIncrementalLassoHitTester%2A> method returns an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester> that considers a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> to be "hit" when the lasso path surrounds it.
This is useful for implementing features, such as the ability to select a stroke with a lasso tool.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> uses an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester> to implement the lasso selection tool.
The minimum percentage of each <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> that must be contained within the lasso for it to be considered hit.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalLassoHitTester"></xref> that hit tests the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Creates an <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester"></xref> that hit tests the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> with an erasing path.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.GetIncrementalStrokeHitTester%2A> method returns an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> that considers a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> to be "hit" when the eraser path intersects it.
This is useful for implementing features, such as the ability to erase part of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> uses an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref> that specifies the tip of the stylus.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester"></xref> that hit tests the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Returns the value of the custom property associated with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.AddPropertyData%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.GetPropertyData%2A> methods enable you to add custom properties to a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
You can then include extra information with a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the custom property to get.
The value of the custom property associated with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
propertyDataId is not associated with a custom property of the .
Returns the GUIDs of any custom properties associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
An array of type <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> that represent the custom property identifiers.
Returns a collection of strokes that have at least the specified percentage of length within the specified rectangle.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the bounds to be hit tested.
The minimum required length of a Stroke that must exist within bounds for it to be considered hit.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that has strokes with at least the specified percentage within the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>.
Returns a collection of strokes that intersect the specified area.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> to hit test.
The size of the area around the <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> to hit test.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects that intersect the specified point.
Returns a collection of strokes that have at least the specified percentage of length within the specified area.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the bounds of the area to be hit tested.
The acceptable length of the , as a percentage, for lassoPoints to contain.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that has strokes with at least the specified percentage within the <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> array.
lassoPoints is `null`.
-or-
percentageWithinLasso is `null`.
lassoPoints contains an empty array.
percentageWithinLasso is less than 0 or greater than 100.
Returns a collection of strokes that intersect the specified point.
The point to hit test.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects that intersect the specified point.
Returns a collection of strokes that intersect with the specified path.
An array to type <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the path to be hit tested.
The that specifies the shape of eraserPath.
A of strokes that intersect with path.
Returns the index of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns -1 if `stroke` is not a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection>.
The stroke whose position is required.
The index of the stroke.
Represents the native persistence format for ink data.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.InkSerializedFormat> field to specify the format of the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> when you transfer data, such as when you copy the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> to the Clipboard.
Inserts a stroke into the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
The specified index.
The specified stroke
Occurs when any <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> property changes.
Event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.PropertyDataChanged"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.OnStrokesChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate, which is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollectionChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when custom property is added or removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Removes the specified strokes from the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Remove%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it removes.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> to remove from the collection.
Removes the stroke at the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The specified index.
Removes the custom property associated with the specified <xref href="System.Guid"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Guid"></xref> associated with the custom property to remove.
Replaces the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Replace%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> to replace.
The source <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
strokesToReplace is empty.
-or-
strokesToReplaceWith is empty.
-or-
A in strokesToReplaceWith is already in strokesToReplace.
Replaces the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> with a new <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Replace%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.StrokesChanged> event for each <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> it replaces.
The destination <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
The source <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
strokesToReplace is empty.
-or-
strokesToReplaceWith is empty.
-or-
A in strokesToReplaceWith is already in strokesToReplace.
-or-
The strokes in strokesToReplaceWith are not continuous.
Saves the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Save%2A> method saves the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> as Ink Serialized Format (ISF).
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to which to save the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
Saves the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> and compresses it, when specified.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Save%2A> method saves the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> as Ink Serialized Format (ISF).
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to which to save the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
`true` to compress the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Replaces the stroke at the specified index.
The position at which to replace the stroke.
The stroke to replace the current stroke.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> in the collection changes.

Modifies each of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke.StylusPoints"></xref> and optionally the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.DrawingAttributes.StylusTipTransform"></xref> for each stroke in the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> according to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
When `applyToStylusTip` is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection.Transform%2A> method affects the shape of the stylus tip, as well as the position of the strokes.
For example, if you rotate a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> 90 degrees, the strokes move around an axis and the height and width of the strokes appear to be inverted.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> which specifies the transformation to perform on the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.
`true` to apply the transformation to the tip of the stylus; otherwise, `false`.
